alert.note: Alert for Montgomery; Northern Liberty (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 03 at 5:17PM CDT by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Montgomery, southwestern San Jacinto and west central Liberty Counties through 545 PM CDT... At 516 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Splendora, or 8 miles west of Cleveland, moving north at 5 TO 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Cleveland, Splendora, Cut And Shoot and North Cleveland. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
